item.title: Opening an URL, an filling out a field
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well to be honest I don’t think it can be done theway you have in mind, and if it is it would be painfully long-winded. As your form does not yet have a submission method in place (or a valid target), I can’t help you with a piece of code, but I would suggest you look into using the URLConnection class sent POST or GET data with (http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/javatips/jw-javatip34.html) or Apache Jakarta Common’s HTTPClient (http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/httpclient/), which I must say is better.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening an URL, an filling out a field
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:4, topic:5068”]Can you please explain what your final goal is with this? Because there’s probably an easier way than the method you have in mind.

Btw, Miss Silabsoft, that’s using the GET method :P[/quote]

There’s several things that can be done with it - Forum spamming, auto register scripts.

All I have in mind is for it to fill out those empty textboxes and submit… =\

item.source: Opening an URL, an filling out a field

item.title: Opening an URL, an filling out a field
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

Basically, I want a program to open a website URL, and fill out one field. The field being a blank textbox.

An example would be:

http://www.freewebs.com/dave-the-rave/form.html

Also - preferably, it’d be good if it didn’t open the browser. This is my nubbed up code so far:

[code]import java.net.*;
public class URL
{

public static void main(String[] args)
{
   
    String cmd = "cmd.exe /C start http://www.example.com";
    try
    {
      
      Process p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(cmd);
	  p.waitFor();
               
    }catch(Exception e)
            {
                System.err.println("Error bringing up browser" );                                      
                
            }
       
  }
    
    
}[/code]

and then it submits it…

Read full topic
item.source: Opening an URL, an filling out a field
